intro: Paris tetraphylla var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved white baneberry, is a perennial herb native to eastern North America. It belongs to the Berberidaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, white, bell-shaped flowers. The plant produces distinctive red berries that are toxic to humans and animals. It thrives in moist, shaded woodlands and is often found in rich, loamy soils. Its botanical features make it a notable species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
